dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Dahanukar, N. 2010. Lepidocephalichthys arunachalensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
EN
Endangered

Red List Criteria
B1ab(i,ii,iii)+2ab(i,ii,iii)

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Dahanukar, N.

Reviewer/s
Daniel, B.A., Rema Devi, K.R., Arunachalam, M., Allen, D.J. & Molur, S.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification
Lepidocephalichthys arunachalensis is recorded from India (Namdapha National Park, Tirap district (Arunachal Pradesh). A recent extensive survey of Arunachal Pradesh did not report the species (Bagra et al. 2009), and other surveys in the area have also not reported the species (Tamang et al. 2007). The AOO is estimated at under 500 km2, and the extent of occurrence is inferred to be less than 2,000 km2 based on the extent of suitable habitat within the protected area. There is extensive deforestation and logging activities within the type locality leading to sedimentation which will impact the species. The type locality is in a National Park, but the effectiveness of protection is uncertain. Whilst the species is recorded from a protected area, there is clear evidence of threats in the surrounding area, including siltation caused by deforestation, which will directly impact the habitat of the species. Based on the available information on restricted distribution and threats to the habitat, this species is assessed as Endangered. However, recent surveys in the type locality and surrounding areas has not yielded this species (Tamang et al. 2007, Bagra et al. 2009), which could mean that the species may potentially be extinct. It therefore requires further studies to establish its current status.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Threats
dataObjects.title: Threats
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Dahanukar, N. 2010. Lepidocephalichthys arunachalensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Major Threats
There is extensive deforestation and logging activities within the type locality leading to sedimentation which will impact the species. The species is found under rocks in gravely streams, a habitat which will be degraded by siltation. The type locality is in a National Park, but the effectiveness of protection is uncertain.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Management
dataObjects.title: Conservation Actions
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Dahanukar, N. 2010. Lepidocephalichthys arunachalensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Conservation Actions
Further information on the species distribution, population and ecology is required. The extent if the impact of sedimentation and general habitat degradation needs to be better understood. The type specimen was collected from the Namdapha National Park, but the quality of suitable habitat within the protected area is not known.
